website_summaries.verdict: Great reliability and expandability options make this the best value for your money when it comes to electric fences.
pros: Big radius (3/4 acre) and can be expanded for more coverage
Includes a "tone only" level of correction
cons: Doesn't work as expected if your lawn is not perfectly flat

customer_reviews.title: Do not trust this device!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not trust this device!!! my dog keeps escaping and it's super unreliable and super dangerous. After just searching for my dog for over an hour I luckily got him home. This is about the 5th time this has happened, so I finally am fed up enough to where I'll never use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Leonard

customer_reviews.title: which didn't make her happy but it really worked
customer_reviews.text: I got my dog at the shelter and it knew no boundaries. She could jump over a 5 ft fence and I didn't know how to keep her in until I got this. She got shocked a couple of times, which didn't make her happy but it really worked. I have had her about a month now and she doesn't even think of leaving the yard unless I take off the collar and take her for a walk. I have a one acre yard and this covers the whole area no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shocking trauma on my German Shepherd.
customer_reviews.text: Went through the process to train my GSD with the containment system. When I walked outside the boundaries to talk to some people walking near my property my dog couldn't resist and attempted to leave the yard. When she stayed too far from the boundary the shock kicked in and my dog started crying in pain trying to escape the shocking. Afterwards, I couldn't get her to leave the porch and she just wanted to stay inside the house. She was afraid to go outside. I've used shock collars in training her previously but this collar pretty much shocked her severely and continuously.
customer_reviews.author: C. D. Wiser

customer_reviews.title: SO Inconsistent. +/- 10 ft in all directions
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited at first for the wireless electric fence because I didn’t want to have to dig my yard. I went to set up the perimeter and flags, but every time I went to set flags the boundary changed. It would beep in the middle of the yard (no where near where I had set the boundaries) , sometimes not shock, and not beep when it needed to. The boundaries were +/- 10ft in all directions, which doesn’t help with training. All in all, it was just so inconsistent and confusing to set up because it would beep in one area once and then not again. Returning for in-ground fencing.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Kruse

customer_reviews.title: wireless dog fence
customer_reviews.text: This is a good idea but the controlled field is a circle with a 180 foot diameter. As the unit has to be mounted inside and our house is quite large and on a hill. There was not a suitable location anywhere on the property to allow our dogs to exit the house and roam the year. This item was returned without being used.
customer_reviews.author: Mazzie

customer_reviews.title: Wireless fence was completely unreliable, now un-returnable. A waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Followed all of the instructions and set up the electric fence in our backyard, we tested it several times and the collar would beep in random locations throughout the yard, whether near the fence or not. Decided to finally call it quits after 2 separate attempts of setting it up and return it, turns out it's too late. Worst 270$ I've thrown away.
customer_reviews.author: E. Gray

customer_reviews.title: I like the idea of a wireless collar than the underground ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of a wireless collar than the underground one. However, this wireless device seems to go off at random times and places. I guess it interferes with our home security system or anything wireless, like our or garage door opener or my neighbors'. I am annoyed that I have to keep resetting the transmitter. The collar even goes off at random times while sitting on my kitchen counter. all in all, if you need a system to keep your dog or cat contained, you better invest in the underground wireless system. Can any body tell me if the underground wireless system can interfere with anything in the house that is wireless??
customer_reviews.author: lisa sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Mis-advertised. Intended for larger pets.
customer_reviews.text: This product is not intended for 8 lbs or larger. My dog is 12lbs and there is no way I can use this on her due to the lengths of the contacts and collar size. This score was placed for this reason alone, as I was not able to test the system. Product is intended for Medium to Large size pets.
customer_reviews.author: Spunky

customer_reviews.title: I have a wild blue heeler and I asked for reviews on this product and received awesome feedback. This breed is very smart so I ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit with the stubborn dog collar for stay and play. I have a wild blue heeler and I asked for reviews on this product and received awesome feedback. This breed is very smart so I didn’t even have to train him. The only thing I am unaware of is if flags were supposed to come with it. Either way, I didn’t need them. He has never gone passed his boundaries even though his girlfriend next door (lab) is out and calling for him to play. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Daryl Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Both our dogs - one old and one only a year - figured out the beep pretty fast. The "training program" they recommend is pretty ...
customer_reviews.text: WOW. I was skeptical, as my dogs have been escaping the fence every.single.day. And I had a buried wire in the past that seemed to break a lot, and a dog that would escape anyway. But this completely worked!! Both our dogs - one old and one only a year - figured out the beep pretty fast. The "training program" they recommend is pretty exhaustive (30 days!) but I would say 3-4 days and these pets were good. They have not escaped yet - weeks in! - and I am so incredibly happy. They are too!
customer_reviews.author: s. c. t.

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: Just unpacked my collar and the battery does not work! So I just ordered a new battery and I’ll wait to see if it’s just a battery issue or if it’s an issue with the actual product. Either way....very frustrating
customer_reviews.author: Abby Sparks

customer_reviews.title: our pup is pretty stubborn and wants to exceed the perimeters and couldnt ...
customer_reviews.text: This collar is working well. It's the first time we have used one.our pup is pretty stubborn and wants to exceed the perimeters and couldnt figure what to do to stop the collar. Once we worked with her to come back in perimeter she hasn't passed it again. We did have to use highest setting to bother her enough to not cross the line.
customer_reviews.author: Glen

customer_reviews.title: Boundaries suck
customer_reviews.text: My dog was in the boundary started beeping and shocked her.... really pissed me off
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I could not get this product to work. It ...
customer_reviews.text: I could not get this product to work. It would work one minute and then stop. I tried phoning the company but they were unable to correct the problem no matter what we did. I want to send it back. It is too expensive to sit in a closet.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT NOW!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I think the collar is a little over priced, but the purpose it serves......well worth it! My dog used to run away all the time, every chance he got. Company was a nightmare as they didn't know and he would take full advantage of unsuspecting guests. We would then spend the next 45-60 minutes chasing him so he wouldn't get hit by a car. Now whether the collar is on him or we forget to put it on in the morning, he stays close like it's on all the time. He doesn't run when seeing other people or pets outside. A simple bark let's them know he's here.
customer_reviews.author: jfkiii0

customer_reviews.title: Good when it holds the battery
customer_reviews.text: Have ordered 3 for my 3 dogs but one will NOT hold the battery. Continues to fall out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not made to last but still worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I love this system. I have a rambunctious rotty and k can't imagine having to keep her on a chain. I love that she can run free ...to an extent. Sure goes to the edge of the boundary and barks at the mailman and kids on bikes but never runs through the barrier. Unfortunately, the collars are NOT made to last. She has already destroyed 2 of them in 2 years. I just keep buying replacements because it's worth it. She gets to burn off all that energy outside instead of in my house. I find that the batteries generally last about 3 months. I buy them on Amazon through Subscribe N' Save.
customer_reviews.author: Starlight

customer_reviews.title: GREAT collar!!!
customer_reviews.text: Read the instructions. I know you're suppose to and we all know none of us do. The collar will be defaulted to beaping only, so you'll have to read how to set that up. The set up at 1 star is because to set that up the instructions are unclear on how many times to press the button to increase the shocking (from level 1-5, lvl 1 is sound only). The rest of it is super easy to set up. Also, check weekly for the light on the collar. If the light is present, the battery will die soon.
customer_reviews.author: Earl Bernie III

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy- randomly shocks your dog
customer_reviews.text: I had this system for 3 days and while my dog was no where near his boundaries, he was inside my house laying on the couch, the collar begins to shock him and it shocked him for 30 seconds straight. I was able to remove his collar and while it was no longer on him it was still shocking randomly. This was such a scary situation and if this had happened when I was not home I'm afraid my dog could have died. I would never want this to happen to someone else's pet so please find another safer way to contain your dog!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Fence
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our medium sized dog for our yard. She was already trained with the beep from a fence she had had before, but this beep is so loud I can hear it clearly from several feet away. Apparently she got away when we were not looking (some neighborhood kids reported her running around the neighborhood) but I guess she had no trouble returning because she came back. The setup was easy, especially with two people. The instructions make sense. My dog was whining constantly until we got it installed; now that has stopped and she is happy to finally have some freedom to run around outside without a leash.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Ottaviano

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for our family!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say this is absolutely amazing! We have a small dog <20lbs. He was constantly running off in our subdivision. We hooked this up and started using it right away. My biggest advise is to follow what the instructions say about preparing your dog for use. We were to rushed in using it and our poor dog was terrified to go outside because of the collar. We started over and went by the recommended training and it worked!!! He never runs off and we didn’t have to dig and bury cable. Please get this you will not regret it!
customer_reviews.author: JAmommynurse

customer_reviews.title: RECOMMENDED FOR PET SAFETY AND FREEDOM
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up--works great. We have a well-behaved, 14 year-old boarder collie mix. Even though she's older, she caught on pretty quickly. Our pet got shocked 3 times before she learned. We have it set on 3/5 (1/5 has no shock) and set at a distance of 4.5 out of 9 for distance. We live in central NC. Our dog is long-haired, so we trimmed the hair under her neck so the longer prongs (we switched from the short to the long as recommended by the instructions). It seems safe. We feel it is humane, especially since it allows us peace of mind and our pet the freedom to roam. We would purchase again and recommend strongly.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kline

customer_reviews.title: My dog is free!!
customer_reviews.text: Works just like it should. Have a 5 month old lab that I hated seeing tied up when outside. Didn't really train him on it I just walked him out to the boundary and let him get shocked once. Now when he hears the beep he definitely knows not to keep going. Shouldn't of turned it up all the way though because that was definitely too much. But now it's turned way down and is just fine
customer_reviews.author: Scott B

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves his new freedom!
customer_reviews.text: This collar is amazing. I have a very hyper 90lb pitbull mix. When I bought this I was not 100% convinced it would actually work for him, but it does! I set it all up myself and he learned his boundaries within 3 days. It works so well he wont even chase my cat across the line. He loves his new freedom and I love not having to stress about him chasing my neighbors when they walk their dogs by my house.
customer_reviews.author: alyssa eaton

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I have an older Husky (10years) who has lived in a large fenced yard his whole life. We moved to a new home and did not have a fence, as the land was much bigger than our previous residence. I thought this option would give him more freedom to roam. I was nervous the first day I left him home alone when I went to work, but he learned quickly. He did get the shock 3 times :( and after that learned where NOT to go. He sticks close to the house and hasn't broken the barrier once. This product is certainly a cheaper option than a fence, and my guy seems to enjoy the freedom to roam. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: kristen

customer_reviews.title: A real lifesaver for lab owner!!
customer_reviews.text: We have a lab that likes to escape and run. We have tried everything to contain her. We recently moved to a house with an acre backyard and can not afford to fence it in. The PetSafe Wireless Dog Containment System was our answer. Our son-in-law set it up for us and it took ONE time of our dog venturing beyond the boundaries for her to learn. She is safe outside alone now!!! I never thought it possible. This product is a lifesaver for us. I can’t recommend it highly enough!!!!!! You might need help setting up. I’m not great with directions. But after that it’s easy peasy!!
customer_reviews.author: Doodle

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: I love my little dog, but live on the lake and he loves to roam. I couldn't fathom the idea of either putting up a fence or a wireless underground fence because he loves to swim in the lake. I bought two transmitters so I have a large area for my dog to run. He taught himself about the barrier and loves his freedom. Best part is I get to keep my dog! :) I'd give it 6 stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: AmazingLove.co

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price, great product, keeps out dog safe and happy
customer_reviews.text: We have a 40 lb female Aussie. I love this collar. It was easy to set up, and she picked up her boundaries very quickly... truth be told, we have had this set up for over a year, and we dont even turn it on half the time anymore, the learning phase taught her the yard perimeter and she just stays in the yard now. I'm sure that wouldnt be the case with every dog but out girl doesnt leave the boundary set out by this collar. We still turn it on when we remember to, just in case. We are helping my husbands grandmother set one up in her yard next week after we highly recommended it to her.
customer_reviews.author: Lysa

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. The real test will be the next couple ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. The real test will be the next couple of weeks. I have a husky who loves to jump the fence. Coming to update the batteries only lasted about 2 months. We took it off for 3 weeks because someone was watching my dog while on vacation and we went to put it back on and the batteries were dead.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Martin

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great. No more problems with the dogs running off and bothering neighbors. I have a large, hard headed yellow black mouth cur dog that has destroyed every kind of fence you can imagine to get out of. To my knowledge he has been “bumped “ twice with his collar and now knows his boundaries. I believe this has helped his overall behavior as well. I live in a metal house and was afraid it wasn’t going to be able to get the signal far enough outside but it works flawlessly. Saved me from having to give my dogs away. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: kwt

customer_reviews.title: ... work unless you have a totally flat yard DON'T waste your money and now that its past 30 days ...
customer_reviews.text: this product doesn't work unless you have a totally flat yard DON'T waste your money and now that its past 30 days they won't give me my money back. BAD customer service......
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Alot cheaper than a fence and it works just as well
customer_reviews.text: My pointer now has the run of the yard without leaving it. This breed is fairly soft when it comes to commands and he stops and returns before the wireless fence but I would have to be close by or he's in the neighbors yard. It took about 2 weeks of training for him with the perimeter flags but he decided to test it. I have it set on the lowest setting and one little nick is all it took but I had to reward him and give him lots of hugs after the event. He's good with it now and he knows his boundaries.
customer_reviews.author: albert92882

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but large transmitter
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for about a week now and it seems to work well. Our dog kept getting in our veggie garden, so we decided this would be our best bet. After his first initial shock, he won't go back there anymore. Unfortunately, to get the boundary where we wanted, we had to move it all the way to farthest back part of our house (our bedroom). The transmitter is huge and an eyesore... Directions say it can't be in a closet unfortunately. I hope it continues to work!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Orth

customer_reviews.title: Dog can run through it and not get shocked
customer_reviews.text: Sure, it was super easy to install and get set up, and it worked at first, I worked with my dogs training them on it like in a video I watched where you start off with just the beep and then work up to the shock. Sure, it worked and shocked my dog and deterred him from going past the flags. HOWEVER, when my dog would get excited and run through the perimeter, it wouldn't register with the base and it wouldn't shock/correct him, rendering it pretty much useless, so we returned it.
customer_reviews.author: GlttrGuitarAngel

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY unless you want to injure your dog both physically and mentally
customer_reviews.text: STAY AWAY! I paid nearly $300 for this system a few years ago and this has resulted in nothing but a scared dog who is now afraid to play. The system itself is so inconsistent. One night, collars off thankfully, it started going off without warning in the house. The house is 100% in boundaries. Do not waste your money or hurt your pets by getting this fence. This should be illegal until they fix the bugs in this system as it is hurting our pets. Shame on you PetSafe, you have lost a customer for life for your negligence.
customer_reviews.author: jfrye1

customer_reviews.title: So far no good!
customer_reviews.text: So far off to a bad start. Trying to set a boundary and as MANY other reviews state it has extremely inconsistent zone warnings.. could be due to the fact that after only 20 minutes of trying to get the boundarie set the battery died. Really, not enough battery life to get through installation!? I have now seen that this problem is fairly common so throw a back up battery in the box at least Pet Safe! Now have to stop setting up and run out for more batteries. HOPEFULLY the boundary will be more consistent with fresh battery or I will be returning this soon!
customer_reviews.author: Djjj

customer_reviews.title: Loved this at first, but doesn’t last.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these containment systems. They both worked well for about four months and then both just randomly stopped working. The collars had fresh batteries. Would even beep when approaching the boundary but wouldn’t shock. My escaped the yard the first time and went missing for three days and come to find out, he found his way about two miles down the road. Collar was still on. Second go round, same thing happened. Dog escaped the yard and ended up almost getting ran over. I’m not buying another. I’m just going to get a tie out and call it a day.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Hudgins

customer_reviews.title: although the people were very nice to talk to
customer_reviews.text: Awful! It didn't work for us at all even after calling them and asking for help, although the people were very nice to talk to. And if you park your car in a driveway it can stun your dog without warning if your car is inside the perimeter. The beeping sound is very quiet and hard to hear. Not a good warning. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. I sent it back!
customer_reviews.author: betty long

customer_reviews.title: Great except around Metal
customer_reviews.text: This system has been a life saver! I have two STUBBORN med/large dogs that actually respect their boundary with this product and they’ve never slowed up for similar systems. I dislike the fact that metal messes with it so much as we have a lot of metal around our home but overall I can get over that and love the system and have happy, safe pups. Side note: we own two systems as one of our properties has acerage - they are equally great when expanded/combined as well.
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: Simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: We replaced our wired underground system with this after it finally broke after 13 years and I am very pleased with it. It covers a wide area and it works. My dogs are already trained on invisible fence so it was as simple as plugging it in, checking the radius of the signal with the collar, and putting down new flags to show boundaries. If your dog is not trained then you will need to train them to the invisible fence.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: works great with our pup
customer_reviews.text: this thing works great! I honestly think it makes a big difference if you can start using it with a pup! We started with the setting on vibrate then moved it to the first shock. All that did was make her scratch ( she sat in the shock zone and scratched). I adjusted it to level 3 and she turns and heads back in the safe area. Love not having to have a chain or other form of restraint on her!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard M. Stropes

customer_reviews.title: no more escape artist!
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST EVER! Expensive but totally worth it. My dogs were escaping from our house/fence at least once a week. We got a new puppy, she is a jumper.. and she broke 3 screens, jumped out the window... it was horrible. We had to keep all the windows shut at all times, This says it takes several weeks for training, but my dogs caught on in about a week. They now have a great time running around the yard but have literally not escaped ONCE since we go this. They are so much safer, and I am SO HAPPY! Thank you, Petsafe!
customer_reviews.author: s. c. t.

customer_reviews.title: Finally no more running wire!! Our dog hasn't left the yard since we have received it.
customer_reviews.text: Finally no more running wire!! We have an overactive dog that will run away at the drop of a hat. We have used the wired version for years, but we have a half acre and while doing construction projects, we always seemed to cut the line. The days of trying to track down breaks in the line are over. We set the wireless system up, mapped out the boundary with the flags, walked the dog around and have had no problems. Total setup took about an hour. completely loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Nick P.

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless containment system.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. We have used this before so we knew exactly what we were getting. Super easy to install, you literally just plug it up and go. The collar has batteries that you replace, lasts for several months. Collar is sturdy that it came with. Has a static shock that you can adjust. We linked our system with another system and made a bigger range for our dogs. Didnt have to do anything to link them, just plugged them up and turned them on. Then you just adjust the settings to the range you would like! Flags are included so you can mark boundaries for your pet.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Johns

customer_reviews.title: Unit defective Collars didn't work
customer_reviews.text: I sent this as a gift for family moving into new house to make let adjustment easier. It did anything but. Adjusting "range," difficult but worst of all a plastic knob broke off unit. Then collars were not working 😰😱😧 the only good news was they were able to get in touch with company to get replacement collars. It is now 3 weeks later and they will see if new collars work. Am very very disappointed and will see if I can get refund if It doesn't work now Only reason for 2 rating was that company answered phone Cannot comment on battery.Life or rain resistance as not operational yet
customer_reviews.author: mary

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: We have a 1yo german shepherd that does really well with this invisible fence. It only took a week or so to train her to stay in the boundary, with minimal work. She responds well to the level 2 beeping. The buzz of the 3 scares her and isn’t necessary. I was hesitant to purchase because of some of the reviews that it’s inconsistent, but it’s been about 5 months of daily use now and we haven’t had any issue! The battery life could be longer(maybe 3 months long) but the replacements are cheap, and fast with prime! Definitely happy with our purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Bryana Ciesielski

customer_reviews.title: lasted less than 4 months
customer_reviews.text: This product is a joke. It worked great for the first two months. Then it decided to work randomly. Kept having to reset the whole system and change batteries on the collar constantly even though the test says they are still working. Thankfully we have good neighbors that bring our dog back whenever he roams the neighborhood because the fence stops working. At the four-month mark it has decided to completely not work at all. I'm pissed at the waste of money but even more pissed that I have to constantly worry about losing my dog until I can get a more reliable system installed. That's going to be hard now that the ground is frozen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product for two dogs
customer_reviews.text: Great product worked wonders for my two labs. One was very stubborn and did not listen to me. Second collar was a breeze to set up. This product changed her into a completely different dog. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Dani28

customer_reviews.title: Awesomeness
customer_reviews.text: If your dog has a problem with digging under a fence or Chewing your ac parts; then this is definitely for you. We had a bit of trouble with the placement. We had it to close to the flags so they were getting pinged in the dining room. But that’s fixed and it’s great I love this. Now I love my dogs a little more. Lol. Awesome. Awesome hands down
customer_reviews.author: arjinette mccreadie

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but not for our irregular shaped lot.
customer_reviews.text: I unfortunately had to send this back. I have used this system before with my stubborn lab girl, but our new yard is oddly shaped and no matter how I adjusted it, it did not contain her. Either I cut off most of the back yard from her use, or the adjustment would give her the freedom to run in the street in the front yard. This is a great solution if you don’t have an odd shaped lot.
customer_reviews.author: Helena

customer_reviews.title: Such a relief!
customer_reviews.text: We spend a lot of time in our backyard, outside in the summer. It seemed like all I did was yell at my dog to come back in the yard! There was just no relaxation going on. With the wireless unit, we can be outside and our dog stays right with us! It is such a relief to not be worrying about her!
customer_reviews.author: Janie

customer_reviews.title: This may work for some dogs, but not my ...
customer_reviews.text: This may work for some dogs, but not my shepherd mix. He's too fast and once he passes the boundary he can't get back in. What worked for us was a remote control collar and much cheaper too!. Only $25!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: I have never done a bad review. Until today. Says half a ache and when installed it didn’t even go 50 feet past the house. And that’s with it plugged in outside to get better range. I ordered this for my parents to keep there dogs in the yard. And they didn’t open the box til it was past return date! So the worse part we can’t even get our money back. Don’t waste your money! Didn’t do anything that it said. False advertisement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stubborn dog finally safe, so worth it
customer_reviews.text: Worked extremely well for a very stubborn Pyrenees pup. They're notorious for roaming their (and everyone else's) land. He went outside the circle once in the past 2 weeks, and that's at the first level. Finally, a way to keep the most stubborn pup I've ever had safely contained. The best almost $300 I've spent, keeps my pup safe and sound :) Trained just like the book said, lots of leash, beeps, and treats, works like a dream
customer_reviews.author: Hilary Ann

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I was going to put up chainlink fence the my wife said how bout we try a invisible fence. So I did the research to find a good one. It took bout 30 minutes to setup. Then to train the dog took a hour cause she's been my hunter for bout 3 years. So I had that advantage. But it works and saved me bout 1000 of fence and hours of labor to do it.
customer_reviews.author: phillip prince

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my dog
customer_reviews.text: I installed it on my own and it was easy to install for the most part, but when trying to figure out where to put the flags, it seemed to beep at one point and then when I checked, it seemed to beep further than where it originally did. Other than that, it has worked well. My dog has stayed in the yard and really learned within a couple of days
customer_reviews.author: Heather Goerger

customer_reviews.title: After 2 months it didn't work and my dog died!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because we had a young dog on a busy road. We set it up, went through weeks of getting her used to the collar and beeps. I noticed sometimes the beeps work and sometimes I wasn't sure. She stayed in the backyard and was nervous going near the perimeter. Then after almost two months with the collar on, she bolted past the perimeter and ran into the road. SHE WAS HIT BY A CAR AND DIED WITHIN THE HOUR!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jacque

customer_reviews.title: This product is unreliable and I would not recommend it to anyone that cares for their dog
customer_reviews.text: This product is unreliable and I would not recommend it to anyone that cares for their dog. My dog frequently leaves the yard - either because the product fails or is ineffective. Likewise the collar often "beeps" in the house when the dog is lying down and not moving and will shock her. Sometimes the collar beeps for no apparent reason when it is not on the dog.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Skip collar, buy the electric wire
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this, but the batteries didn’t last long and when we changed them out the collar won’t stop beeping randomly. We did all the trouble shooting, like the instructions told us and it still beeps. Also, the boundary wall doesn’t have any impact anymore because it is not working properly. The window to return it has closed and I wish I would have just bought the electric wire that you bury underground to begin with. It was significantly cheaper and has more positive reviews than this collar and my neighbor has the underground fence and their dog doesn’t leave the yard ever. So, my advice, skip the collar and buy the wire.
customer_reviews.author: Behind Blue Eyes

customer_reviews.title: Great solution at a great price point
customer_reviews.text: I have used this in the past and loved the solution. Never had an issue. Just make sure you keep some spare batteries on hand for the collar. Ordered this one for my daughter for her home. 5 minutes to set it up the other day. Still working on the dog training (not the sharpest mutt I have ever met). But he is learning, just not quite there yet after only short training sessions. To be fair its sub zero winter days here so the training sessions are pretty short.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: New after 20 y w old one
customer_reviews.text: This was my second unit in 20 y. We left for vacation and something went nuts. The collar was continually beeping and occasionally shocking him in his safe zone. He was terrified. She turned the unit off. Collar continued she took it off and wouldn’t stop until the battery was removed. My Aussie was very traumatized. He is 3 y and knows this system well.
customer_reviews.author: Horse Lady

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: The battery life for the collar batteries seems to be less than you would think. Also battery life is very inconsistent between the two collars. Word of CAUTION- when the power cycles the unit sometimes sends out a signal to the collars that will shock your dog even if they are within the perimeter of the unit, i.e. inside the house. May want to remove collars when inside. Also, found that other wireless signals can cause the collar to beep, which will trigger your dog into reacting.
customer_reviews.author: R. Labbe

customer_reviews.title: Traumatized
customer_reviews.text: Worst purchase ever. We have a rescue hound who’s only bad habit was running off. He loved the yard UNTIL we used this product. It’s been days and he now refuses to leave the hallway afraid of both my husband and myself and refuses to go outside. We followed the instructions to a T / and now it’s only regret and remorse.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! I have a 109lb lab/huskey mix who has a digging problem. I moved into a new house with a very large backyard and wanted to prevent him from digging out so bought this right when I moved in, needless to say the dog has not escaped I can now leave my front door open and where he would have run off before he doesn’t. I would say this is an amazing product for people who have animals that are a little more impulsive.
customer_reviews.author: Jag

customer_reviews.title: Our dog loves it and so do we
customer_reviews.text: We have an 8 mo. Old lab mix puppy and wanted an invisible fence so we did not have to burry the wires. Took a few tries, as we expected, to find the best placement in our home and to set the proper radius. The training went much better than expected and only took a week for him to learn his boundaries. Love, love, love him being able to use our whole yard and to no longer have to watch out for his lead.
customer_reviews.author: Julia S.

customer_reviews.title: We love this product!
customer_reviews.text: This product is saving my beloved little dog's life! It's so nice to be able to just plug it in, put the collar on and not have to worry about whether or not the doors of our home have been left open. The battery is do not last long! You will need to buy several batteries to keep in stock but luckily they are very cheap. My brother also has this product, so all I have to do is bring my color over to his house and it works off of his box without doing anything extra. We love this product!
customer_reviews.author: krystle B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Investment
customer_reviews.text: This is a great investment. I have a lab and husky. Our lab learned how to jump the fence and broke the latch on the gate. Our Husky decided to go on an adventure due to the broken gate. My husband and I invested in the system to keep our dogs in the yard. It was a great buy. Our dogs have had more room in our yard beyond the fence. The beeping on the collars gives them enough warning to back away from the area. The system eases our mind when our dogs go outside.
customer_reviews.author: Amee

customer_reviews.title: Will never buy another brand! This is the best!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best product ever! We had before for our dog, but our house burnt. I tried several others and went back to this brand. Dogs stay in yard and it works excellent!! Best brand out there! Do not waste money on the cheaper ones they are horrible! This one is the only one that I have found to work (Great Danes and Rottweilers dogs)!
customer_reviews.author: Tara clark

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive to only last a year.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about 10 months, then started being inconsistent. My dog would get zapped sitting next to me in the house and wouldn’t get zapped running after a rabbit into street. Now all the collar does is beep, no zap. He has figured this out and goes exploring. I came on here to check out a replacement collar figuring I did have it a year...they are half the price of a whole new system and I’m not even sure the collar is the problem! I’m so disappointed I mean what’s the point of it if it only works sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product. Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Product is terrible, used it for a few months and then it broke, it is completely unresponsive and will not power on whatsoever. Collars are fully charged and they have their light that blinks but there is no connection to the actual system. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Krystene

customer_reviews.title: my dogs are faster than this fence
customer_reviews.text: This was a huge waste of money. The second my retriever ran the collar beeped after she left the containment. She and my dachshund are apparently too fast. Let’s be real my dachshund is not fast by any means. We spent hours trying to get this to work and every single time they made it through the containment. I’m not impressed. I honestly wouldn’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie-Marie Reed

customer_reviews.title: Not what they used to be like
customer_reviews.text: These used to have a lot more hootzpah let's say. I don't know whether it coincided with the politically correct term "static correction" replacing the apparently distasteful term "shock" but the collar before on setting 4 made my German Shepherd do a somersault with at least a couple notches to go. This thing at max setting seems to be little more than an annoyance. Apparently you have to get the collar for "stubborn" dogs to get the full Monty. Just be advised.
customer_reviews.author: B&C FugettTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Will Shock your dog consistantly if it fails
customer_reviews.text: Used this for 3 months then it suddenly stopped working. We turned off the fence for a day and it started to work again. A little later we realized the dog didn't care about getting zapped anymore, we increased the shock and now she stays in the fence. *Update* Fence started shocking our dog for no reason, practically torture. Please do your pet a favor and do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Sukusia

customer_reviews.title: No wire to deal with
customer_reviews.text: We put this system in at our new house because we didn’t want to have to bury wire. It takes some setting up, getting the correct area and placement. My husband is unable to hear the sound and the light indicator for the collar didn’t work, so I got to walk around bent over placing flags. So far our dogs have stayed inside but they have been previously trained and stay back from the flags. Overall, once it was set up I’m very glad that we got it.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila M.

customer_reviews.title: Regret buying it
customer_reviews.text: It's impossible to get the right place to put the base unit. The ONLY place I could put it was in a utility closet by the back door in the middle of the back side of the house. The heat pump for the heating and air is outside by the left corner of the house. One of the dogs has figured out that if he goes behind that the collar doesn't work. Same to the right. The garage is to the right so the signal may or may not work there either. There are too many requirements and restrictions for this system to work. It was a waste of money for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jim W

customer_reviews.title: life saver
customer_reviews.text: I had to buy this for my dog because she kept chewing through our fence and getting out and running a mock! I love this device because it was my last solution to be able to keep my dog safe while no one is home. It is a life saver and has taken a load of stress off my back so I am forever great full for this! I do wish they had different options for colors for the collar. I would buy a pink one if it were available
customer_reviews.author: missy

customer_reviews.title: Depends on what you want this for
customer_reviews.text: I returned my PetSafe wireless fence because it didn't suit my purpose. Although it is pretty simple to set up and use, it can only be used in a circle with the base unit as the center...and seeing as the base unit cannot be kept outside that means the circle must be around the house. I definitely do not want my dog to be able to run around the house. I want her in a controlled area where I can look out the window and see her or go out and work training with her. Both of those things are nearly impossible with this fence.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl A Huckins

customer_reviews.title: Scary moment and threw away product
customer_reviews.text: These almost got our dog hit by a car as he was staying in his boundary until one day he didn’t and when he got out it continued to zap him and he freaked out into the front of a car which thankfully stopped quickly as he was yelling and we were trying to get him out of it. After this we threw it away and never used this product again. That was extremely scary. He basically while freaking out kept going in the boundary and back out as it would rezap him.
customer_reviews.author: 1CrazyLife4Me

customer_reviews.title: Simple to install fence
customer_reviews.text: This containment system works great for both large and small dogs. This is my third unit. First one is about 10 years old. Additional units were purchased for other locations. Set up is easy right out of the box. Plug in the base and teach the dog the boundary area. No digging fence into the ground or putting up ugly chain link fence. Batteries last about a month in the collar. Replacement batteries are inexpensive to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Parkey

customer_reviews.title: Very poor reliability, only lasted 1 year.
customer_reviews.text: If it works, it works well. But I have had two collars fail and now the transmitter has failed, so beware. They really need to design this for more reliability. If you don't mind spending this amount of money every couple of years, then get it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love this system
customer_reviews.text: We have a 90 lb. American bulldog. He likes to wonder away and has a hearing problem if he gets loose or out of reach. Once set up and very first try he challenged the boundary. One time corrected, and we have not had even one more issue. Worked great. We actually turned the collar down to 2. We're very pleased with the results and would highly recommend. Even for those large stubborn breeds of dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Mastiffs Contained😄
customer_reviews.text: While this took a few minutes for the collar and transmitter to communicate, this item works perfectly. We have Mastiffs and it took less than a day for them to learn their safe boundaries. I suggest to start the boundary setting small to allow time to connect. Then create the desired size perimeter.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: The best purchase I've ever made for my dog. I live in the country, but people are stupid and have the bogus idea that pitties are dangerous. While everyone lets dogs run free or here, I worry someone will kill her just based on her bread. She can now play outside without me worrying that she'll roam too far.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Died right after the return window, FML.
customer_reviews.text: Worked initially, but now it's stopped working. Sad. Died right after my return window closed so I've only had it just over a month.
customer_reviews.author: Critter

customer_reviews.title: Such a great investment!
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing!! My dog has the ability to run in the yard and im not nervous about her going out of her boundaries bc she saw a bunny. She hears the beep that she is getting close to getting shocked and she backs off immediately. The training process is a little rough bc they have to get beeped and then get shocked to know what will happen but it's so worth it in the end. Love this system!! The battery has lasted us almost two months already which is pretty good id say. You just have to go out and make sure it isn't dead before you put the collar on her. Very happy over all!
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Not ideal for a big yard.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my mix pup. Radious isn't far enough. She got shocked a few times by it... sounded like it REALLY hurt. We ended up getting a remote one. Thats works better for us. If the radius were a bigger range, it would have worked. I think.
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: Did not find useful
customer_reviews.text: Awful. Radically uneven distances so that the perimeter did not look like a circle but rather like a jagged star. In addition, the color goes off at different distances with regard to the same flag. So sometimes you get a shock 3 feet before the flag, sometimes a foot after. Unfortunately, the technology is just not where it needs to be.
customer_reviews.author: Gio Valiante

customer_reviews.title: When we see or hear coyotes, we can pull his “zone” in very easily. That’s assuring!
customer_reviews.text: We have 1.3 acres and this works perfect for us. We really don’t want him more than 80-90 feet from the house (coyotes), so it’s absolutely spot on for our yard. When we visit my mom, I grab the flags and retrain him. I’m pretty sure he associates the collar with staying in the vicinity of the house. I’ve seen some reviews saying that it doesn’t work if you have a sloped yard but I have to differ. We have had the unit for four years and had our collar quit working. I was amazed that it was in my front porch by noon on Monday after just ordering it on Saturday!!
customer_reviews.author: cherie j.

customer_reviews.title: Too strong of a shock for our dog on lowest setting
customer_reviews.text: Installation was easy and the instructions to use the system to train your dog is easy to follow and understand. However, when we first used the "correction" mode of the collar on our dog, day 4 of training on the lowest correction setting (2), she screeched and was terrified for hours afterwards hiding in our house. Had to return it, as it's too powerful for her... and we'll seek other means to train her. Our dog is ~25 lbs and 18 months old.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Ed

customer_reviews.title: Already opened and poorly resealed
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived previously opened, cut across the whole plastic package, that cut inside paper material with scotch tape all over outside to try and reseal the plastic package. Contents inside looked new, fresh battery enclosed and collar powered right up. Have not tested it with the inground fence yet. So basically I’m not sure this is a new collar opened and returned or, used and refurbished for resale...?
customer_reviews.author: DeAquitaine

customer_reviews.title: Intermittent False Warnings/Correction
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep my German Shepherd from going to the neighbors property. It is keeping her close, but it is also beeping/shocking her while she is in range, even in the next room. This is confusing to her. I'm considering returning this product, but I also really need it to keep her close. I hate to change things up again since we spent time training her on this system. It's too bad it's not working well.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Buying lots of needlessly proprietary batteries is their business model.
customer_reviews.text: The system works pretty well. But, I’m disappointed because the proprietary and expensive batteries were dead upon arrival and that Pet Safe excluded a power button for the collar. This either intentional omission or huge oversight means that the customer needs to buy many of their expensive and proprietary batteries. I imagine this design was intentional meaning lots of battery use and purchases is part of their business model for this product. It’s wasteful and expensive. I hope they revise their collars to take an off the shelf battery and include a power switch.
customer_reviews.author: Chism H.

customer_reviews.title: Works great and dogs learn quick
customer_reviews.text: Only took a couple of times going outside of the area for both of my dogs to learn not to go very far from the house. One of my dogs actually chews the collar off the other but luckily did not damage the actual sensor part so I just ordered another collar and only put it on him when they are not left alone together. My one dog has not had the collar on for 3 weeks and still does not got outside the boundary.
customer_reviews.author: Skurdlybird

customer_reviews.title: Maxed out in 18 months
customer_reviews.text: I have had this pet containment system for 2 years now and it has not been working for several months. The pieces on the collar unscrew and get worn down easy. The first 6-12 months of use was nice. It worked and the dogs knew their territory. So, in theory, this product works. I just question it's durability. I ordered and replaced the batteries for the collar a few times over the 2 years, but this time, the battery did not work. Not sure of the issue and it does not look like I can contact anyone about it.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Thompson

customer_reviews.title: This is poor customer service after spending 259
customer_reviews.text: The collar device is no longer working after receiving it on June 17, 2015. Today is September 2nd. I went to see if I could get a replacement collar only to find out that the device is not available for exchange. This is poor customer service after spending 259.95. I recommended this device to my friend when it was working, I will make sure that I tell them I no longer recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Spencer

customer_reviews.title: unusual size yard
customer_reviews.text: I was going to use the doggy fence for a new puppy. I have an unusual size yard and could not get this product to work well at all. We could hear to beeping then when we put the collar on the dog the collar would not beep. After many tries we just got seriously frustrated. My son in law who has a different brand and is very used to them tried with calls to the support group with no positive results. I would like to return this product but have been unsuccessful with getting a return slip or talking with anyone who is willing to help me. I can not recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Kay C.

customer_reviews.title: Beware! The collar is not consistent.
customer_reviews.text: We have the rechargeable collar and the red collar that comes with this system. No issues with the black collar, but the red collar that comes with the system started to randomly go off and start shocking the dog when she is laying right next to the transmitter. Of course, I bought this system in June so it's just outside the 90-day policy. When you pay $140 for a collar, I expect to last longer than 3 and a half months. Garbage product for the money you spend.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustom861

customer_reviews.title: No good!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this at the end of December and ita February 5th now and the cheap collar broke already. I bought a system years ago exactly like this and the collar was much better quality. I knew when i received the collar it wouldnt last long. This cost too much for it to break so quick. Dont buy this product!!! I attached a picture...clasp broke and fell off. My dog could have ran away with out his collar on. Peoples pets are very special to them like children and you should be ashamed of yourself for making something such low quality.
customer_reviews.author: mart Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Collars don't last
customer_reviews.text: We bought this collar in January of this year and it has already stopped working. It only worked for about 8 months. I've tried new batteries and everything. It had quit beeping a long time ago, but my dog knew her boundary and it would still have a low static shock if she went out of the boundary but now it doesn't work at all. That's a lot of money to spend since this is already the 2nd collar we have had to replace in less than a year and a half. When it works it works great, but its irritating to have to keep buying collars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The collar stops working and is too expensive
customer_reviews.text: Have had it for 5 years now and it has worked great but yesterday the collar inexplicably stopped working and my dog ran away. Have tried resetting the collar and the unit a ton of times with no luck - it simply won't beep anymore. A replacement collar is $130 which is ridiculously high. If you're going to buy a $260 system don't buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Eric T Knight

product_meta.title: PetSafe Wireless Dog and Cat Containment System – from the Parent Company of INVISIBLE FENCE Brand – Above Ground Electric Pet Fence
product_meta.description:
Style:Wireless Fence

Description:

The PetSafe Wireless Containment System allows you to create a secure 1/2 acre circular boundary around your yard without the hassle of burying wire or installing a physical fence. To set up, simply place the Wireless Containment System transmitter in a weather¬proof location, plug into an outlet and adjust the dial to cover the perfect size area for your dog. Coverage can be personalized from 5 to 90 feet in all directions from the base unit or up to 180 feet across. This portable system sets up in 1 2 hours so you can easily take it with you when you go camping or go on vacation. This Wireless fence comes with the PetSafe Wireless Pet Containment System Receiver Collar. The battery operated collar features a tone only mode for training plus, plus 5 adjustable levels of correction depending on your dog's temperament. The collar adjusts to fit neck sizes between 6 28 inches and is recommended for pets who weigh 8 pounds and up. With the purchase of additional PetSafe Wireless fence collars, the Wireless Containment System will contain an unlimited number of pets with a single system.



Includes:

 * Transmitter with power adaptor
 * Waterproof adjustable collar
 * PetSafe RFA 67 battery
 * 50 training flags
 * Test light tool
 * Short and long contact points for short or long haired pets
 * Product Manual
 * One year warranty



Compatible Collars:

 * Stay & Play Wireless Fence Collar (PIF00 14288)
 * Stubborn Dog Stay & Play Wireless Fence Collar (PIF00 13672)
 * Free to Roam Wireless Fence Collar (PIF00 15002)
 * Wireless Pet Containment System Collar (PIF 275 19)



Compatible Fence Systems & Transmitters:

 * Stay & Play Wireless Fence Kit (PIF00 12917) and Transmitter (PIF00 13210)
 * Stay & Play Wireless Fence for Stubborn Dogs Kit (PIF00 13663)
 * Free to Roam Wireless Fence Kit (PIF00 15001) and Transmitter (PIF00 15348)
 * Wireless Pet Containment System Transmitter (IF 100)



Need Additional Information?

Let our U.S. based pet product experts help. We're available Monday through Saturday to answer your questions at 1 800 845 3274. PetSafe brand has been a trusted global leader in pet behavior, containment and lifestyle innovations for nearly 30 years. We help pets and their people live happily together.
feature_bullets: 1/2 acre of circular coverage: The adjustable circular range can cover up to 1/2 acres from the placement of the portable indoor transmitter
No wire to bury: A wireless boundary allows you to create a secure barrier around your yard to protect your pets without the time or hassle of burying wires
Static free re-entry: Unlike traditional in ground fences, this wireless fence allows your pet to return home without being corrected if your pet passes the boundary
Simple set up: Sets up in just a few hours; This portable system is terrific for camping and vacation homes
Waterproof collar: The waterproof collar comfortably fits dogs 5 pounds and up and adjusts to fit neck sizes 6 to 28 inches; Compatible with all PetSafe Wireless Fence transmitters
Long battery life: The collar battery lasts up to 2 months before the low battery indicator alerts you to replace the battery; Uses the PetSafe RFA-67D-11 battery
Personalize your dog's collar settings: Teach your pets to stay in the secure play area with a sound-only training mode plus 5 levels of static on his receiver collar
Add more than 1 pet: Unlimited number of collars can be added to the fence system and set to match your pets' personalities

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
